item.title: Rebecca add a quote by Nathaniel Hawthorne
item.description: "In this republican country, amid the fluctuating waves of our social life, somebody is always at the drowning-point." -- Nathaniel Hawthorne

item.title: Rebecca add a quote by William Shakespeare
item.description: "There are more things in Heaven and Earth, Horatio, than are dreamt of in your philosophy." -- William Shakespeare

item.title: Rebecca add a quote by Richard Lovelace
item.description: "I could not love you, dear, so much Loved I not honor more" -- Richard Lovelace

item.title: Rebecca add a quote by William Cowper
item.description: "God moves in mysterious ways His wonders to performs" -- William Cowper

item.title: Rebecca add a quote by Anne Brontë
item.description: "I cannot love a man who cannot protect me." -- Anne Brontë

item.title: Rebecca add a quote by Nathaniel Hawthorne
item.description: "As a general rule, Providence seldom vouchsafes to mortals any more than just that degree of encouragement which suffices to keep them at a reasonably full exertion of their powers." -- Nathaniel Hawthorne

item.title: Rebecca add a quote by Nathaniel Hawthorne
item.description: "Strength is incomprehensible by weakness, and, therefore, the more terrible." -- Nathaniel Hawthorne

item.title: Rebecca add a quote by Gabriel García Márquez
item.description: "Dr Urbino did not agree: in his opinion a Liberal president was exactly the same as a Conservative president, but not as well dressed." -- Gabriel García Márquez

item.title: Rebecca add a quote by Gabriel García Márquez
item.description: "What Uncle Leo XIII never suspected was that his nephew's courage did not come from the need to survive or from a brute indifference inherited from his father, but from a driving need for love, which no obstacle in this world or the next would ever break." -- Gabriel García Márquez

item.title: Rebecca add a quote by Gabriel García Márquez
item.description: "By virtue of marrying a man she does not love for money. That's the lowest kind of whore." -- Gabriel García Márquez

item.title: Rebecca add a quote by Richard Doddridge Blackmore
item.description: "But whatever lives or dies, business must be attended to; and the principal business of good Christians is, beyond all controversy, to fight with one another." -- Richard Doddridge Blackmore

item.title: Rebecca add a quote by Ann Coulter
item.description: "I am the illegal alien of commentary. I will do the jokes that no one else will do." -- Ann Coulter

item.title: Rebecca add a quote by Ann Coulter
item.description: "I'm a Christian first, and a mean-spirited, bigoted conservative second, and don't you ever forget it. You know who else was kind of "divisive" in terms of challenging the status quo and the powers-that-be of his day? Jesus Christ." -- Ann Coulter

item.title: Rebecca add a quote by Ann Coulter
item.description: "As far as I'm concerned, I'm a middle-of-the-road moderate and the rest of you are crazy." -- Ann Coulter

item.title: Rebecca add a quote by Ann Coulter
item.description: "No matter what argument you make against evolution, the response is <I>Well, you know, it's possible to believe in evolution and believe in God.</i> Yes, and it's possible to believe in Spiderman and believe in God, but that doesn't prove Spiderman is true." -- Ann Coulter

item.title: Rebecca add a quote by Ann Coulter
item.description: "The Democratic Party supports criminals and Islamic terrorists but has no sympathy for taxpayers." -- Ann Coulter

item.title: Rebecca add a quote by Ann Coulter
item.description: "Guns are our friends because in a country without guns, I'm what's known as "prey." All females are." -- Ann Coulter

item.title: Rebecca add a quote by Ann Coulter
item.description: "As the saying goes: God made man and woman; Colonel Colt made them equal." -- Ann Coulter

item.title: Rebecca add a quote by Ann Coulter
item.description: "When conservative judges strike down laws, it's because of what's in the Constitution. When liberal judges strike down laws (or impose new laws), it's because of what's in the <i>New York Times</i>" -- Ann Coulter

item.title: Rebecca add a quote by Truman Capote
item.description: "Those fellows, they're always crying over killers. Never a thought for the victims." -- Truman Capote

item.title: Rebecca add a quote by Richard Doddridge Blackmore
item.description: "It seemed to me that if the lawyers failed to do their duty, they ought to pay people for waiting upon them, instead of making them pay for it." -- Richard Doddridge Blackmore

item.title: Rebecca add a quote by Stephen King
item.description: "Faith is a great thing, and really religious people would like us to believe that faith and knowing are the same thing, but I don't believe that myself. Because there are too many different ideas on the subject. What we <i>know</i> is this: When we die, one of two things happens. Either our souls and thoughts somehow survive the experience of dying or they don't. If they do, that opens up every possibility you could think of. If they don't, it's just blotto. The end." -- Stephen King

item.title: Rebecca add a quote by Stephen King
item.description: "their respect for the mystery--the half-grasped but never spoken idea that maybe, when you got right down to the place where the cheese binds, there is no such <i>thing</i> as marriage, no such thing as union, that each soul stood alone and ultimately defied rationality. That was the mystery." -- Stephen King

item.title: Rebecca add a quote by Randy Alcorn
item.description: "The conflicting missions of the two armies seemed to have no fog, no gray, only black-and-white clarity. I had lived my life in terms of compromise, rule-bending, trade-offs, concessions, bargaining, striking deals, finding middle ground. In these two great armies, there was no such thing. Good was good, and evil was evil, and they shared no common ground." -- Randy Alcorn

item.title: Rebecca add a quote by Randy Alcorn
item.description: "The vermin explain their sin with sanctimonious language like, "We've prayed about it and sought counsel, and we feel it's the right thing to do." Don't let it down on them that to the Enemy what they feel is inconsequential. His moral laws don't give a rip about how any of them feel. The sludgebags have no more power to vote them in and out of existence than they have power to revoke the law of gravity." -- Randy Alcorn

item.title: Rebecca add a quote by Douglas Adams
item.description: "The major problem&mdash;<i>one</i> of the major problems, for there are several&mdash;one of the many major problems with governing people is that of whom you get to do it; or rather of who manages to get people to let them do it to them. To summarize: it is a well-known fact that those people who must <i>want</i> to rule people are, ipso facto, those least suited to do it. To summarize the summary: anyone who is capable of getting themselves made President should on no account be allowed to do the job." -- Douglas Adams

item.title: Rebecca add a quote by Jane Austen
item.description: "When once married people begin to attack me with, 'Oh! you will think very differently, when you are married,' I can only say, 'No I shall not'; and then they say again, 'Yes you will,' and there is an end to it." -- Jane Austen

item.title: Rebecca add a quote by Evelyn Waugh
item.description: "No one could really hate a saint, could they? They can't really hate God either. When they want to Hate Him and His saints they have to find something like themselves and pretends it's God and hate that." -- Evelyn Waugh

item.title: Rebecca add a quote by Evelyn Waugh
item.description: "Then I knew that the sign I had asked for was not a little thing, not a passing nod of recognition, and a phrase came back to me from my childhood of the veil of the temple being rent from top to bottom." -- Evelyn Waugh

item.title: Rebecca add a quote by Evelyn Waugh
item.description: "I've always been bad. Probably I shall be bad again, punished again. But the worse I am, the more I need God. I can't shut myself out from His mercy. ... Or it may be a private bargain between me and God, that if I give up this one thing I want so much, however bad I am, He won't quite despair of me in the end." -- Evelyn Waugh
